channel.title: [Class idea] Sorcerer/warlock (large edit)
channel.description:
I'm aware other players have suggested other classes named warlock, but this one is different.
**Sorcerer** Blue dragon offensive
**Hellish rebuke** (Day, 2 uses) Any player who attacks you the following night will be occupied the next two nights (This bypasses occupy immunity) **Self-destruct** (night, 1 use): Kill yourself. Reveals the class of every player who visited you the night you use this the following day (x, the y, visited the sorcerer last night) **Forcecage** (night, infinite uses) (You do not visit target) target player is occupied
**Converted class (warlock)** Unseen Offensive **One with shadows** (passive) If you do not use any ability at night, you will be seen as the sorcerer to investigators. **bestow curse** (night, infinite uses) target is occupied until you use this ability again, die, or are occupied yourself. **Temporary Damnation** (Day, 1 use) Target leaves an empty body (as though they were reaped,) and returns to it at the end of three days, supposing they were not murdered in that time.

item.title: [Class idea] Sorcerer/warlock (large edit)
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Hellish rebuke (passive) Any player who attacks you will be occupied the next to nights

How would this effect Possessor who is immune to Occupation? What about Cult Sacrifices?

Self-destruct (night, 1 use): All players who attacked someone to night will visit you, as will all observers

This is way too overpowered… you’re practically revealing all the Killer classes to an Observer or two.

Forcecage (night, 4 uses) (You do not visit target*) target player is occupied.

4 uses? You’ve got a very limited BD class… after 5 nights of ability uses, you’re useless

Complacency (passive): No trial may take place the day following the mastermind’s death (Player’s are not informed of this; the game raises the required amount of votes to put a player on trial to 9001)

I still don’t like this idea. You shouldn’t treat Mastermind’s death as if Fool died. Besides, in some instances,
Unseen will need to rely on votes to help remove NK, this could backfire.

Conjure Nightshade (night, 1 use): The assassin is given an extra use of the nightshade ability.

No, no, no, no! Assassin should never be given a free nightshade from another class.

Mirror image (Night, 2 uses) This player will appear as their unseen version when investigated Until you use this ability again

Wait? So once you use this on someone, they’ll be that until you use the ability again? Like a buffed Framer? That’s a bit too strong. Also, another very limited class with only 3 uses on their total abilities. You become useless after 3 nights of ability usage.

item.title: [Class idea] Sorcerer/warlock (large edit)
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Magic surge: Possibility to edit it so that this only happens once

self-destruct: One person said this is extremely powerful, another said it is detrimental to yourself. This ability is supposed to be used sparingly, as it can be detrimental to self, but also can be good to your faction.The reason it has infinite uses is because I assumed that the sorcerer would die the first time they used it.

Erase memory: [quote=“ThePlex, post:6, topic:2116”]
Again… hurting your own faction… let’s say you used it on Sheriff. And Infinite uses? That’s very unbalanced. If you found Mastermind, you could essentially keep them alive and just use it over and over until you’ve gotten rid of Assassin + Other potential converts
[/quote]

Suppose the butler role blocked a fellow blue dragon member. He would have hurt his own faction. In regard to your mastermind criticism, I can see how this would be a problem; perhaps a rule could be implemented that once you use it on a player, you cannot use it on that player again.

Drain life[quote=“ThePlex, post:6, topic:2116”]
What… how would this go un-noticed?
[/quote]

The point is that players need to figure it out for themselves. If no player gets enough votes the next day, then it will go unnoticed. Also, many evil roles out themselves after doing an ability, such as the illusionist’s ability to erase from the chat log.
I agree that the name of the ability needs reworking, suggestions are accepted.

Conjure nightshade:

ThePlex:

This is what Forage is for, this is a bad idea

The idea is the assassin could kill this night AND gain nightshade,

JammySplodge:

No absolutely not

I would be willing to rework this to lower the uses of this ability to 1 or 2. Other than that, it is not overpowered.

Teleport: [quote=“JammySplodge, post:5, topic:2116”]
This could work but I feel it being infinite would be a little too powerful
[/quote]

Many classes have multiple night abilities.I can understand the concern, though; lowering to three would be appropriate, I feel.

Read full topic

item.description:

Self-destruct (night, infinite uses): All players who left their room tonight will target you instead. This cannot cause you to be converted.

This would essentially hurt your own faction. You’re stopping Princess, Sheriff/Paladin, Observer, possibly Psychic from doing their jobs…

RopeStringFace:

Erase memory (night, infinite uses): Target player cannot use whatever night ability they used this night for the next two nights, as they forgot how.

Again… hurting your own faction… let’s say you used it on Sheriff. And Infinite uses? That’s very unbalanced. If you found Mastermind, you could essentially keep them alive and just use it over and over until you’ve gotten rid of Assassin + Other potential converts

RopeStringFace:

Drain life (passive): No trial may take place the day following the mastermind’s death (Player’s are not informed of this; the game raises the required amount of votes to put a player on trial to 9001)


What… how would this go un-noticed? People are a lot smarter and know exactly how many votes are needed with the number of alive players. By that point, you’d have been outted and they’d know you exist. And how has that got to do with anything related to draining a life?

RopeStringFace:

Conjure Nightshade (night, 3 uses): The assassin is given an extra use of the nightshade ability.


This is what Forage is for, this is a bad idea

[quote=“RopeStringFace, post:1, topic:2116”]Teleport (night, infinite uses): The next time the target player attempts to use the ability they used tonight, they will target themselves instead.

A copy of the Sage ability: Shock.
